# Data & Variable types

---

## Variables
--

- any text that is not enclosed in "" or ''
- without brackets at the end, e.g. test()
- not predefined words

```{r variables}
"number"
number = 5
number
"text"
text <- 'R is amazing'
print(text)
```

---

## Data types
--

```{r data_types, eval = F}
input
"text"
1.5
20L
TRUE
FALSE
Sys.Date()
Sys.time()
0 / 0
```

---
## Data types cont.

```{r data_types_comments, eval = F}
input # variable (not an actual data type)
"text" # character
1.5 # numeric
20L # integer
TRUE #boolean
```
```{r data_types_comments_eval}
Sys.Date() # Date
Sys.time() # POSIXct POSIXlt
NA; 0 / 0 # this is bad idea
```

# Arithmetic & logic operators

---

## Arithmetic operators

```{r arithmetics}
2 + 7
x = 2; y = 7
x + y
y - x
y^x
y/x
```

---

## Arithmetics operators cont

```{r arithmetics_cont}
x = 2; y = 7
y %% x
y %/% x
```

---

## Arithmetic functions

```{r arithmetics_functions}
x = 1:10
sqrt(x) # log(), exp(), sin(), ...
sum(x)
mean(x) # median(), quantile(), ...
```

---

## Arithmetic functions cont.

```{r arithmetics_functions_cont}
summary(x) # can be used on data.frame and many other types 
```

---

## Sequences

```{r sequences}
x = 6; y = 15
x:y
seq(x, y, by = 2.5)
seq_len(y)
seq_along(x:y)
rep(y, x)
```

---

## Logic operators

```{r boolean}
TRUE & FALSE
c(T, F) & T
c(T, F) && T
T | F
!F
```

---

## Comparison

```{r comparison}
"a" == "b"
2 != 5
2 %in% 1:5
3.985 < 7
5.61 >= 5.61
```

# Subsetting (slicing)

---

## Names (indexing)
- vectors, lists can have position names
- data.frames and matrices can have rownames and colnames

```{r naming}
c(a = 3, "b" = 4)

namevec = 1:3
names(namevec) = c('a', 'b', 'c'); namevec

list(g = 1, "h" = "R is very kind")
```

---

## Names cont.

```{r naming_cont}
namemat = matrix(1:4, 2)
colnames(namemat) = c("eq.1","eq.2")
rownames(namemat) = c("x","y")
namemat

namedf = data.frame("a" = 1L:3L, b = c('a','b','c'))
rownames(namedf) = c("Jana","Mirka","Lisa")
namedf
```

---

## Slicing in general
- can be done via three specifications
  - numeric position, e.g. third, fifth and seventh position
  - names, e.g. position 'Jana' and 'Mirka'
  - boolean, e.g. TRUE, FALSE, TRUE (same as the first and third position)

---

### Slicing vectors

```{r slice_vec}
testvec = 1:6
names(testvec) = c("a", 'b', "c", "d", 'e', "f")
testvec[2]
testvec[c(3,5)]
testvec[1:3]
testvec[c('a','d')]
```

---

### Slicing vectors cont.

```{r slice_vec_cont}
testvec[testvec < 4]
sec_vec = 6:1
testvec[sec_vec < 4]
```

---

### Slicing lists

```{r slice_list}
testlist = list(a = matrix(2,1), "b" = c("R","is very kind"), c = T, d = NA)
testlist[c(2, 4)]
testlist[c('c','a')]
```

---

### Slicing lists cont.

```{r slice_list_cont}
testlist[1]
testlist[[1]]
# alternatively
testlist$a

testlist[[2]][1]; testlist$b[1]
```

---

### Slicing matrices

```{r slice_matrix}
namemat

# no dollar notation
# names hard to use
namemat[2,c(1, 2)]
namemat[c(1, 2), 2]
```

---

### Slicing data.frames

```{r slice_df}
namedf
namedf[1,c(1,2)]
namedf[2,'a']
namedf['Jana','b']
```

---

### Slicing data.frames cont.

```{r slice_df_cont}
namedf[c('Jana','Mirka'), c('a','b')]
namedf$a
namedf$b[1]
namedf[namedf$a < 2,]
```
